body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":4112,"title":"Delaware Township School closure updated information","body":"
As of Monday, March 16, DTS has moved to a virtual/remote learning environment for all DTS students. Please know that follow-up information will continue to be sent via email, list serve and posted on the district and teacher webpages.\n
Per Governor Murphy, all New Jersey schools will be closed until at least May 15. Details to follow next week of 4/20/20 through email and website.\n
As of 6 PM Friday, March 13, all afterschool, evening, and weekend activities will be cancelled/rescheduled until further notice. This includes all facility use events and all athletic practices, games and competitions.","dateStart":"2020-04-16T19:23:20Z","baseGroupName":"Delaware Township School District","hash":"2Bp0HErZDvC3WKIKQLICc0uzMzVqxhGXqGId9yNER0U=","updateDate":"2020-04-16T19:26:26Z"}];

section.h3: Early Dismissal - Last day for Students

div.p: The 2020 DTS Yearbook is still on sale! All grade levels (pre-K through 8) are represented on the full-color pages of the yearbook! Special events like Halloween, Read Across America, and Pink Day are showcased in the yearbook. In addition, sports teams, music groups, clubs, field trips, assemblies, and grade level collages are also featured.

Books cost $24 and personalization is included! Make sure to enter the personalization text exactly how you want it to appear on the front of the yearbook (for example: John Doe) in the 'DIGITAL NAME IMPRINTS' box.

Reserve your copy online today! Go to the website: yearbookordercenter.com and enter the DTS School Code: 20197. IF you think you may have already ordered a book, you can check your order status on the website as well.
At this point, a final delivery date for yearbooks is still to be determined depending on several factors.
Thank you.
DTS Yearbook Staff
Please see attachment for more details.

Delaware Township School is pleased to formally announce our 2019-2020 Governor Educator of the Year (GEOY) and the Educational Services Professional of the year. The honor this year goes to Angela Mikula, Art Teacher, and Jean Domurat, preschool support. The New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE) aims to recognize educators and encourage them to become champions for education and advocates for students and teachers at the county, state and national levels.

Ms. Mikula, a seasoned veteran Art teacher at DTS, is a dedicated educator who strives to offer DTS students a comprehensive art experience at all grade levels. She recently completed a residency in the UK through a Fulbright Scholarship, where she developed the concept of Mindfulness through the process of creating art. She has since added new programs, a Mindfulness Garden and many new art opportunities for our students through her learning.

Ms. Domurat, who has recently joined the DTS staff, works tirelessly to help our preschoolers have a warm and loving entrance into the world of education. Her dedication as a parent to programs such as Terra recycling and the Girls Scouts organization has proven her to be a true asset to the DTS community. Her efforts with the Girls Scouts recently won a new Gazebo for the school grounds to be used for campus beautification.
Congratulations to our winners!

The Conserve Wildlife Foundation’s SPECIES ON THE EDGE art and essay contest provides an opportunity for fifth graders from across NJ to choose one of NJ's endangered or threatened species of wildlife and draw a picture and write an essay about its habits and habitats. Winners are chosen from every participating county. This year, CWF received over 2,000 entries.
Delaware Township took 2nd place in Hunterdon County.
Congratulations Audrey Hammill for your depiction of an endangered Piping Plover.

li.data-sub-html: Audrey Hammill Gr5, 2nd Place Hunterdon County Species on the Edge Art and Essay contest

div.title: Audrey Hammill Gr5, 2nd Place Hunterdon County Species on the Edge Art and Essay contest

div.p: Congratulations Kiera Yarrow, winner of the District 19 level of the Patriot's Pen essay contest. District winners were recently honored at the Patriot's Pen luncheon on February 8 at the VFW Post 2290 in Manville, NJ.

li.data-sub-html: Kiera Yarrow, District 19 Patriot's Pen essay contest winner

div.title: Kiera Yarrow, District 19 Patriot's Pen essay contest winner

div.p: The results are in for the school champion of the National Geographic GeoBee. We started with 13 contestants:
Ben Andresen, Nate Ruttenberg, Noah Smith, Lucas Rumage, Lydia Hamill, Lauren Haines, Sophia May, Allie Devlin, Jade Dodds, Mary Kate Herman, Jake Gates, Ed Cooper, and Abby Curtis
After many rounds of suspenseful questioning, we made it down to five finalists and then in third place is Ben Andresen, second place Sophia May, and finally first place belongs to Jake Gates.
Jake now has the opportunity to take a qualifying test that will if determine if he’s eligible for the New Jersey State Bee in March. Congratulations to all the participants!

li.data-sub-html: 2020 National Geographic Geo Bee
2020 National Geographic Geo Bee
